result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl Lee Kazee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Attempt Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay Restitution in the amount of $525 to Deshawn G-H.  Restitution to be paid first - before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges. Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

EACH COUNT: Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied. DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: 239 days credit concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Count 2.
Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 3 (three) years of the sentence has been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs without a valid prescription.
No Contact Order with Deshawn G-H and/or her family.

Take all prescribed medication.
Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health Unit.
AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes: COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl Lee Kazee

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Darryl M. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191005 in court 1x on 1/19/16.
Request for payment of $17.00 witness fees for witness Deshawn G-H. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26191004 in court 1x on 1/19/16.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 1/20/16 for Deshawn G-H, Darryl M. for 1 appearance each on 1/19/16.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, Deshawn G-H., defense counsel and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. 

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  2  years with  239 days credit concurrent to the sentence imposed as to Count 2; -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1  year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  1 year.  

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  15  years with  239 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  4 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  11 years.  

Court finds defendant   IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program  and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 3 (three) years of the sentence has been served.

-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $525

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-  Defendant to be supervised by the Mental Health unit
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Take all prescribed medication
-  No Contact Order with Deshawn G-H   AND/OR  her family
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $525 to Deshawn G-H.  Restitution to be paid first - before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in court with Attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties inform Court that defendant will be entering an Alford plea.

During the plea colloquy Court orders case passed.  Case recalled.

As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant waived rights and entered an ALFORD Plea as to both counts.   Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for an Alford plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Off the record discussion with the parties and the Court prior to the case being called on the record.

Case called on the record:
Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Carl Lee Kazee not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing.
Final pre-trial held with the parties.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Carl Lee Kazee not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference conducted.  Defense counsel requests this matter be set for final pretrial and a court trial.  

Parties are informed that effective December 14, 2015, this matter will be reassigned to Br. 28, Judge Sanders, Room 629 of the Courthouse. Final pretrial set for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 26 for BRANCH 21
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Court orders $10,000.00 cash bail reinstated and all previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.  Court orders case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Doctors Report Return on Wednesday, November 4, 2015 at 1:30 PM in BR 26, CH Rm 634 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Various correspondences received regarding defendant regaining Compentency.  Matter needs to be brought before Court sooner than thecc scheduled November 30, 2015 return date that was originally set in September.  Br. 21 not in session week of November 2, 2015.  As this matter needs immediate attention, Br. 26 will hear this matter on November 4, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.  All parties notified.
From Mendota Mental Health dated October 16, 2015 received and filed.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Carl Lee Kazee not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Report indicates defendant not competent but may regain competency.  Court finds defendant is not competent to proceed, but may regain competency.  Matter adjourned for Return on Doctor's report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report from Dr. Karyn Gust-Brey received and filed.
Forensic Tracking Report received and filed.
Forensic Tracking Report
Forensic tracking report received and filed.

Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn for Megan Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received and reviewed the competency report submitted by the doctor.  Defense counsel is not contesting the findings of the report. Court held colloquy with the defendant, and found that the defendant is not contesting the report. Court ordered the proceedings suspended and the defendant be remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending transportation to a state mental health facility to be restored to competency. Order for Commitment for Treatment signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Competency report dated 07/01/2015 received and filed.

Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court, defendant Carl Lee Kazee not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant raises competency pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.13.   Court suspends proceedings and orders defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department.  Defense waives time limits for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.
Clerk:  jms

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no alcohol and no possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Deshawn GH; Keshawn H.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Carl Lee Kazee in custody.  
Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).              Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
